description: Trace the lost river and discover abandoned island of Channelsea, then visit the newly founded urban oasis of Abbey Gardens on this walk, talk and eat exploration of this hidden history of the tidal Lea Valley and site of  London's now rapidly vanishing industrial past. Consider the opportunity to make new urban green spaces that celebrate both wild and manmade environments in harmony.

factsheet.heading: Walk on the Wildside
paragraphs: This walk is inspired by the Remote London - Seeking wildness & space around Greater London website (https://www.remotelondon.com/exploring-channelsea-island/ ) and my own work as an architect, researcher and advocate of conserving/rewilding the London's urban green/blue landscape and associated industrial legacy infrastructure.

images.title: OS Map of 1898 showing Abbey Mills Pumping Station and the island -https://www.remotelondon.com
Abbey Gardens - Community Growing and making - https://www.abbeygardens.org/

travel_info:
Additional travel info: Start:  Bromley-by-Bow station- Circle, District and Hammersmith and City lines.
Finish: Abbey Road DRL stop

name: GKA2024 Channelsea River to Abbey Gardens - Lost + Found Places
